intro: Linaria odoratissima, commonly known as the sweet willie or sweet scabious, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is characterized by its bright, showy flowers that range in color from yellow to orange and red. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 centimeters and has slender, branched stems covered in fine hairs. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a slightly fuzzy texture. Linaria odoratissima thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for garden cultivation.
